Node.definition: plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= person who is closely associated with God, who speaks on behalf of God, and through whom inquiries can be made of God

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= town and cult centre, also referred to as Beth Aven (בֵּית אָוֶן) or simply Aven (אָוֶן) ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) near the border of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)
= man; ◄ son of Nebath (נְבָט) ► former servant of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= man; ◄ son of Amon (אָמֹון) ► king of Judah (יְהוּדָה) (ca. 640 609)
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= causative action by which humans kill one or more animals, usually for food

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so
= causative action by which humans set alight and cause smoke to rise from the sacrificial fat parts of an animal, of grain and other offerings, including incense ► as an offering to a deity
= any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= supernatural act of a deity, ◄ performed by the deity himself or in his name; ►in order to assert his power and greatness

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= supernatural act of a deity, ◄ performed by the deity himself or in his name; ►in order to assert his power and greatness
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

Node.gloss: to tear|to rend|to cut|to rip|to split
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands
= causative action by which humans pour out a liquid or dry substance
= remainders of the fat of animals after it has been burned
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= person who is closely associated with God, who speaks on behalf of God, and through whom inquiries can be made of God
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= town and cult centre, also referred to as Beth Aven (בֵּית אָוֶן) or simply Aven (אָוֶן) ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) near the border of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action
= man; ◄ son of Nebath (נְבָט) ► former servant of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to stretch out (one's) hand|to stretch out (one's) right hand|to lay (one's) hand
Node.definition: = action by which humans stretch out their hand, right hand, or finger in order to do point with it or to put it in position for another action

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible
literally: to bring back (one's) hand; hence: = action by which humans draw back their hand that had been streched out before
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.definition: = relation denoting that someone performs a certain event for the benefit of someone or something else
literally: to come back; hence: = process by which an object is restored to its former condition

= object given to someone else

= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= causative action by which humans put a piece of cloth on the back of an animal; ► in order to be able to ride on it

= domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see עַיִר (עַיִר) female see אָתֹון (אָתֹון)

= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

= terebinth; tree with a broad crown, heavy branches, and thick trunk; may reach a height of 7.5 to 9 m.; sheds its leaves; has small an inconspicuous flowers; ◄ pictacia terebinthus; ► its stem contains aromatic turpentine, a resinous juice, which flows out when the bark is cut; it provides pleasant shade; ≈ imposing tree, preferred place to sit under and enjoy the shade, associated with cultic worship

Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include wailing (ילל) tearing one's clothes, putting on sackcloth (שַׂק) covering oneself with dust or ashes, fasting (צום) or eating specific food, cutting oneself (גדד) shaving one's head (קרח) covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

= to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect

= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= town and cult centre, also referred to as Beth Aven (בֵּית אָוֶן) or simply Aven (אָוֶן) ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) near the border of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן)

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= district around the town of Samaria; ◄ ranging from valley of Jezreel (יִזְרְעֶאל) in the north to the valley of Aijalon (אַיָּלֹון) in the south, with the Mediterranean and the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) as its respective western and eastern borders; ► after the conquest of the town of Samaria repopulated with people from other nations
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X takes place after Y has ceased existing or has been completed

Node.gloss: to turn back from|to give up|to retire from
Node.definition: literally: to turn (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans or deities stop being engaged in a certain activity
= man; ◄ son of Nebath (נְבָט) ► former servant of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
literally: to make (people in a certain role); hence: = causative action by which humans in authority or deities assign a certain task to (other) humans
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event

Node.gloss: to ordain|to install in office|to consecrate
Node.definition: literally: to fill (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which someone ordains another person to be a priest

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
literally: to fill (someone's) hand; hence: = causative action by which humans ordain other humans to the office of priest or a similar role
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= place of worship, often situated in an elevated location, but not necessarily so
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= man; ◄ son of Nebath (נְבָט) ► former servant of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) who later became the first king of the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= causitive action or process by which humans or deities forcibly terminate the existence of an individual or group of people

Node.gloss: to destroy|to exterminate|to wipe out|to demolish
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
